links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Again."
links.english: Again.
links.polish: Znowu.
links.belarusian: Зноў.

links.title: You: "Nothing?"
links.english: Nothing?
links.polish: Niczego?
links.belarusian: Нічога?

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Nothing, sad brother. No treachery...."
links.english: Nothing, sad brother. No treachery. Just blackout.
links.polish: Niczego, smutny bracie. Żadnej zdrady. Tylko zapomnienie.
links.belarusian: Нічога, смутны брат. Ніякай здрады. Толькі забыццё.

links.title: You: "Just lie there, passed out."
links.english: Just lie there, passed out.
links.polish: Leż po prostu nieprzytomny.
links.belarusian: Проста ляжы без прытомнасці.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Well, *almost* nothing. There is th..."
links.english: Well, *almost* nothing. There is the ground below you. That's still there. And the small light that's on -- fluttering -- somewhere in the Basal Ganglia.
links.polish: No, *prawie* niczego. Jest ziemia pod tobą. Ona wciąż istnieje. I małe, migoczące światełko, które świeci się gdzieś u jąder podstawnych.
links.belarusian: Не, *амаль* нічога. Ёсць зямля пад табой. Яна ўсё яшчэ існуе. І маленькае, міргаючае святло, якое гарыць недзе каля базальных ядер.

links.title: You: "Who's that?"
links.english: Who's that?
links.polish: Kto to?
links.belarusian: Хто гэта?

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "That's me, blue eyes. That's me."
links.english: That's me, blue eyes. That's me.
links.polish: To ja, błękitnooki. To ja.
links.belarusian: Гэта я, блакітнавокі. Гэта я.

links.title: You: "And who was *that*?"
links.english: And who was *that*?
links.polish: A kto *to* był?
links.belarusian: А хто *гэта* быў?

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Who was what?"
links.english: Who was what?
links.polish: Kto był kim?
links.belarusian: Хто быў кім?

links.title: Limbic System: "He speaks of the *sickening* longin..."
links.english: He speaks of the *sickening* longing, the unwell emotion. Even in the darkness he's grasping for it, still trying to hold on to the great sorrows slipping in the water -- slimy.
links.polish: Mówi o *przyprawiającej o mdłości* tęsknocie, niezdrowej emocji. Nawet pośród mroku szuka jej palcami, wciąż próbuje uchwycić przemykające wśród wód oślizłe, wielkie smutki.
links.belarusian: Гаворыць пра *виклікаючую млоснасць* настальгію, нездаровую эмоцыю. Нават сярод цемры шукае яе пальцамі, усё спрабуе злавіць, як слізкія вялікія сумы, што мільгаюць у водах.

links.title: You: "Yeah, that's the stuff!"
links.english: Yeah, that's the stuff!
links.polish: Tak, właśnie tak!
links.belarusian: Так, менавіта так!

links.title: Limbic System: "Here in the Paleo-Mammalian Cortex..."
links.english: Here in the Paleo-Mammalian Cortex we call it -- *the shadow*.
links.polish: Tu, w układzie rąbkowym, nazywamy to *cieniem*.
links.belarusian: Тут, у рамцы з валікамі, мы называем гэта *ценем*.

links.title: Limbic System: "Because it's always there."
links.english: Because it's always there.
links.polish: Bo zawsze gdzieś tam jest.
links.belarusian: Бо заўсёды дзесьці там ёсць.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Tell him! Tell him!"
links.english: Tell him! Tell him!
links.polish: Powiedz mu! Powiedz!
links.belarusian: Скажы яму! Скажы!

links.title: Limbic System: "Ah, yes. And in the olfactory syste..."
links.english: Ah, yes. And in the olfactory system they call it The Apricot Chewing Gum Scented One. It's unhealthy of them to linger on it so. But -- as they say -- what do you do?
links.polish: Ach, tak. A w układzie węchowym nazywają tego kogoś Pachnącą Morelową Gumą Do Żucia. Niezdrowo jest tak kurczowo się tego trzymać. Ale – jak mawiają – co począć?
links.belarusian: Ах, так. А ў нюхавой сістэме называюць гэтага кагосьці Пахучай Абрыкосавай Жавальнай Смолкай. Нездарова так моцна за гэта трымацца. Але – як кажуць – што рабіць?

links.title: You: "Smelled so nice..."
links.english: Smelled so nice...
links.polish: Tak ładnie pachniała...
links.belarusian: Так прыемна пахла...

links.title: Limbic System: "It didn't smell *nice*. It smelled..."
links.english: It didn't smell *nice*. It smelled like BETRAYAL.
links.polish: Nie pachniała *ładnie*. Pachniała ZDRADĄ.
links.belarusian: Яна не пахла *прыгожа*. Яна пахла ЗДРАДАЙ.

links.title: You: "Smelled like betrayal."
links.english: Smelled like betrayal.
links.polish: Pachniało zdradą.
links.belarusian: Пахла здрадай.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Yeah, man. Fuck *everything*. Total..."
links.english: Yeah, man. Fuck *everything*. Total blackout forever.
links.polish: Tak jest. Jebać *wszystko*. Wieczne zapomnienie na zawsze.
links.belarusian: Так ёсць. Драць *усё*. Вечнае забыццё назаўсёды.

links.title: You: "Was that the ex-something? The..."
links.english: Was that the ex-something? The...
links.polish: Czy to było eks-coś? Czy to był...
links.belarusian: Ці было гэта былым? Ці быў гэта...

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "...bloated corpse of the past, resu..."
links.english: ...bloated corpse of the past, resurfacing?
links.polish: ...rozdęty trup przeszłości wyłaniający się z odmętów zapomnienia?
links.belarusian: ...раздуты труп мінулага, які вымалёўваецца з пучын забыцця?

links.title: You: "No, it was beautiful!"
links.english: No, it was beautiful!
links.polish: Nie, była piękna!
links.belarusian: Не, была прыгожая!

links.title: Limbic System: "*Beeaautiful*... Believe me, stupid..."
links.english: *Beeaautiful*... Believe me, stupid ape, its lack of beauty was *not* the problem.
links.polish: *Pięęękna*... Uwierz mi, głupia małpo, że to *nie* brak piękna był problemem.
links.belarusian: *Прыгажуня*... Павер мне, дурная малпа, што *не* адсутнасць прыгожасці была праблемай.

links.title: You: "Yes, that."
links.english: Yes, that.
links.polish: Tak, właśnie.
links.belarusian: Так, менавіта.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Don't prod at it, it will start mov..."
links.english: Don't prod at it, it will start moving again.
links.polish: Nie poszturchuj go, bo zacznie się znowu poruszać.
links.belarusian: Не штурхай яго, бо ён зноў пачне рухацца.

links.title: You: "Where is Voyager Road?"
links.english: Where is Voyager Road?
links.polish: Gdzie jest Voyager Road?
links.belarusian: Дзе знаходзіцца Voyager Road?

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "There is no Voyager Road. There are..."
links.english: There is no Voyager Road. There are no roads. No houses. No lights in the windows. It's all on *pause*.
links.polish: Nie ma Voyager Road. Nie ma żadnych ulic. Żadnych domów. Ani świateł w oknach. Wszystko jest *zatrzymane*.
links.belarusian: Няма Voyager Road. Няма ніякіх вуліц. Ніякіх дамоў. Ні святла ў вокнах. Усё *застыла*.

links.title: You: "So my name appears to be... Harry?"
links.english: So my name appears to be... Harry?
links.polish: A więc zdaje się, że moje imię to... Harry?
links.belarusian: Дык здаецца, што маё імя... Гарры?

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Your name is *fuck all*."
links.english: Your name is *fuck all*.
links.polish: Nazywasz się *Jebać Wszystko*.
links.belarusian: Цябе завуць *Усіх Чартоў*.

links.title: Limbic System: "It certainly ain't Harry."
links.english: It certainly ain't Harry.
links.polish: Na pewno nie Harry.
links.belarusian: Напэўна, не Гары.

links.title: You: "Then what is it?"
links.english: Then what is it?
links.polish: To jak mam na imię?
links.belarusian: Як мяне завуць?

links.title: Limbic System: "Your name is *Passed Out on the Gro..."
links.english: Your name is *Passed Out on the Ground*. Dragged around by one of the other evil apes. They're taking you somewhere...
links.polish: Nazywasz się *Nieprzytomny na Ziemi*. Ciągnie cię któraś z pozostałych podłych małp. Dokądś cię zabiera...
links.belarusian: Цябе завуць *Непрытомны на Зямлі*. Цябе цягне адна з астатніх подлых малпаў. Некуды цябе вядзе...

links.title: You: "There was something about a bow col..."
links.english: There was something about a bow collector too...
links.polish: Było też coś o pantografie...
links.belarusian: Было таксама нешта пра пантограф...

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Yeah, man, what was that about?"
links.english: Yeah, man, what was that about?
links.polish: Tak, chłopie, o co chodziło?
links.belarusian: Так, хлопец, пра што ішла гаворка?

links.title: You: "Enough... just lie there, motionles..."
links.english: Enough... just lie there, motionless.
links.polish: Dość... Leż po prostu bez ruchu.
links.belarusian: Досыць... Проста ляжы без руху.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "You think they would let you -- unt..."
links.english: You think they would let you -- until you disintegrate into biomolecules? No, someone is breathing on your face now, inspecting your pupils. Stupid idiot.
links.polish: Myślisz, że tak ci pozwolą, aż rozpadniesz się na biomolekuły? Nie, ktoś dyszy ci właśnie w twarz, ogląda twoje źrenice. Przygłup jeden.
links.belarusian: Ты думаеш, што табе так дазволяць, пакуль не распадзешся на біямалекулы? Не, хтосьці ўдыхвае табе проста ў твар, глядзіць у твае зрэнкі. Дурачок нейкі.

links.title: You: "I'm not coming back..."
links.english: I'm not coming back...
links.polish: Nie wracam...
links.belarusian: Я не вяртаюся...

links.title: Limbic System: "Oh, but you are. They're pouring so..."
links.english: Oh, but you are. They're pouring something on you, *in* you. It's...
links.polish: Och, ależ wracasz. *Leją* coś na ciebie. Do twojego *wnętrza*. To...
links.belarusian: Ох, але ж вяртаешся. *Льюць* нешта на цябе. У тваё *ўнутранае*. Гэта...

links.title: Perception (Taste): "It's DELICIOUS."
links.english: It's DELICIOUS.
links.polish: To PRZEPYSZNE.
links.belarusian: ГЭТА СМАЧНА.

links.title: Coupris Kineema: "Glowing lights on a dashboard emerg..."
links.english: Glowing lights on a dashboard emerge out of nothingness.
links.polish: Z nicości wyłaniają się światełka na desce rozdzielczej.
links.belarusian: З нічога з'яўляюцца агеньчыкі на прыборнай панэлі.

links.title: You: "...where am I?"
links.english: ...where am I?
links.polish: Gdzie ja jestem...?
links.belarusian: Дзе я...?

links.title: Coupris Kineema: "In the upholstered cabin of Lieuten..."
links.english: In the upholstered cabin of Lieutenant Kitsuragi's motor carriage, seated in the driver's basket. The air is thick with leatherworks and heavy fuel oil. Cold water runs down your chin.
links.polish: W tapicerowanym wnętrzu powozu motorowego porucznika Kitsuragiego – siedzisz w fotelu kierowcy. Powietrze jest ciężkie od zapachu skóry i ciężkiego oleju napędowego. Po brodzie cieknie ci zimna woda.
links.belarusian: У абітым тканінай салоне матарызаванага экіпажа лейтэнанта Кіцурагі – ты сядзіш у крэсле кіроўцы. Паветра цяжкае ад паху скуры і цяжкага дызельнага паліва. Па барадзе цячэ халодная вада.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Drink -- water." The lieutenant is..."
links.english: "Drink -- water." The lieutenant is extending a small canister to your mouth.
links.polish: „Pij. Woda” – porucznik wyciąga w stronę twoich ust niewielki pojemnik.
links.belarusian: «Пі. Вада», — лейтэнант падае да тваіх вуснаў маленькі кантэйнер.

links.title: You: ""You're back?""
links.english: "You're back?"
links.polish: „Wróciłeś?”
links.belarusian: «Вярнуўся?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhmh. Now drink." He raises the ca..."
links.english: "Mhmh. Now drink." He raises the canister.
links.polish: „Mhm. A teraz pij” – unosi pojemnik.
links.belarusian: «Мгм. А цяпер пі» — падымае ёмістасць.

links.title: You: "Drink."
links.english: Drink.
links.polish: Pij.
links.belarusian: Пі.

links.title: Coupris Kineema: "The water is cold, silvery  -- the..."
links.english: The water is cold, silvery  -- the stuff of *life itself* as it pours down your parched throat. The pounding in your head recedes, the darkness parts.
links.polish: Woda jest zimna, srebrzysta – wlewa się w twoje wysuszone gardło niczym *życie*. Łomotanie w twojej głowie ustaje. Mrok się rozprasza.
links.belarusian: Вада халодная, срэбрыстая — уліваецца ў тваё высахлае горла, нібы жыццё. Грукат у тваёй галаве сціхае. Цемра разыходзіцца.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Drink." He tilts the canister. "Yo..."
links.english: "Drink." He tilts the canister. "You haven't drunk water in two days. Did you know the human body is not made to survive on alcohol *alone*? You need a secondary form of hydration."
links.polish: „Pij” – przechyla pojemnik. „Nie piłeś wody od dwóch dni. Wiesz, że ludzkie ciało nie jest w stanie przeżyć na *samym alkoholu*? Potrzebujesz też innych form nawodnienia”.
links.belarusian: «Пі» — нахіляе ёмістасць. «Ты не піў вады два дні. Ведаеш, што чалавечае цела не можа выжыць на *самым толькі спіртным*? Табе патрэбны і іншыя формы гідратацыі».

links.title: Rhetoric: "Actually, beer and cider have *load..."
links.english: Actually, beer and cider have *loads* of water in them.
links.polish: Tak się składa, że piwo i cydr mają w sobie *mnóstwo* wody.
links.belarusian: Так атрымліваецца, што піва і сідр утрымліваюць *шмат* вады.

links.title: You: ""You know, in the Franconigerian ce..."
links.english: "You know, in the Franconigerian centuries, the quality of water was so bad it was sometimes more hygienic to drink beer."
links.polish: „Wiesz, w stuleciach frankonigeryjskich jakość wody była tak zła, że czasem higieniczniej było pić piwo”.
links.belarusian: «Ведаеш, у стагоддзях франконігерыйскіх якасць вады была настолькі дрэннай, што часам гігіенічней было піць піва».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But these are not the *Franconiger..."
links.english: "But these are not the *Franconigerian centuries*. We are in the present. It is safe to sometimes drink water here." He hands you the canister.
links.polish: „Ale to nie są *stulecia frankonigeryjskie*, tylko teraźniejszość. Bezpiecznie jest napić się tu czasem wody” – podaje ci pojemnik.
links.belarusian: «Але гэта не *франконігерыяцкія стагоддзі*, а сучаснасць. Бяспечна іншы раз выпіць тут вады», — падае табе кантэйнер.

links.title: You: ""You know, I'm actually more of a *..."
links.english: "You know, I'm actually more of a *magnesium* based lifeform now."
links.polish: „Wiesz, jestem obecnie bardziej *magnezową* formą życia”.
links.belarusian: «Ведаеш, я зараз больш *магнітавай* формай жыцця».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's just a drug addict myth. In..."
links.english: "That's just a drug addict myth. In reality you're still comprised of dihydrogen oxide, which you must replenish to go on living."
links.polish: „To tylko pokutujący wśród narkomanów mit. W rzeczywistości wciąż składasz się głównie z tlenku wodoru, który musisz uzupełniać, żeby żyć dalej”.
links.belarusian: «Гэта толькі міф, які распаўсюджваюць сярод наркаманаў. На самай справе ты ўсё яшчэ складаешся галоўным чынам з аксіду вадароду, які ты павінен дапаўняць, каб працягваць жыць».

links.title: You: "Drink."
links.english: Drink.
links.polish: Pij.
links.belarusian: Пі.

links.title: Coupris Kineema: "With greedy gulps, you down half a..."
links.english: With greedy gulps, you down half a litre of cold water. Some of it spills on the driver's seat -- the lieutenant pays no heed to it.
links.polish: Łapczywymi łykami pochłaniasz pół litra zimnej wody. Część z niej wylewa się na siedzenie kierowcy. Porucznik nie zwraca na to uwagi.
links.belarusian: Ласыўнымі глыткамі паглынаеш паўлітра халоднай вады. Частка яе выліваецца на сядзенне кіроўцы. Лейтэнант не звяртае на гэта ўвагі.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What happened?""
links.english: "What happened?"
links.polish: „Co się stało?”
links.belarusian: «Што здарылася?»

links.title: You: ""I should ask you the same.""
links.english: "I should ask you the same."
links.polish: „Powinienem cię spytać o to samo”.
links.belarusian: "Я павінен быў спытаць цябе пра тое ж самае".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You were reading your paperwork. T..."
links.english: "You were reading your paperwork. Then you passed out. I carried you to my Kineema... to take you to a hospital. Then you came to."
links.polish: „Czytałeś swoje dokumenty. A potem straciłeś przytomność. Przyniosłem cię do swojej kineemy... żeby cię zawieźć do szpitala. I wtedy doszedłeś do siebie”.
links.belarusian: «Ты чытаў свае дакументы. А пасля страціў прытомнасць. Я прынёс цябе ў сваю кінаматаграфію… каб адвезці цябе ў бальніцу. І тады ты апрытомнеў».

links.title: You: ""How long was I out?""
links.english: "How long was I out?"
links.polish: „Jak długo byłem nieprzytomny?”
links.belarusian: «Як доўга я быў без прытомнасці?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ten minutes maybe.""
links.english: "Ten minutes maybe."
links.polish: „Może z dziesięć minut”.
links.belarusian: «Можа, хвілін дзесяць».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know. It could have been q..."
links.english: "I don't know. It could have been quite a while." He looks you in the eye, as if inspecting your mental state.
links.polish: „Nie wiem, mogło minąć sporo czasu” – spogląda ci prosto w oczy, jakby oceniał twój stan psychiczny.
links.belarusian: «Не ведаю, магло прайсці шмат часу» — глядзіць табе прама ў вочы, быццам ацэньвае твой псіхічны стан.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There was a call on the shortwave:..."
links.english: "There was a call on the shortwave: officer passed out in Martinaise." He furrows his brow. "I had a feeling it would be you. I'm glad I got here in time."
links.polish: „Na falach krótkich poszło powiadomienie – nieprzytomny funkcjonariusz w Martinaise”. Marszczy brwi. „Podejrzewałem, że to ty. Dobrze, że zdążyłem na czas”.
links.belarusian: «Па кароткахвалях пайшло апавяшчэнне — непрытомны супрацоўнік у Мартынайсе». Насупіўся. «Думаў, што гэта ты. Добра, што паспеў своечасова».

links.title: You: ""I came in contact with the burnt o..."
links.english: "I came in contact with the burnt out ruins of the past, lieutenant." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Nawiązałem kontakt z wypalonymi ruinami przeszłości, poruczniku”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: «Я ўстанавіў кантакт са спаленымі руінамі мінулага, лейтэнант». (Скончана).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That does sometimes happen." He ha..."
links.english: "That does sometimes happen." He hands you the remains of your ledger.
links.polish: „Tak się czasem dzieje” – oddaje ci resztki twojego notatnika.
links.belarusian: «Так часам здараецца» — аддае табе рэшткі твайго нататніка.

links.title: Rhetoric: "He replies with such understanding..."
links.english: He replies with such understanding it's as if the burnt out ruins of the past were an occupational hazard -- athlete's foot for cops.
links.polish: Odpowiada ze zrozumieniem, jakby wypalone szczątki przeszłości były po prostu ryzykiem zawodowym. Takim policyjnym łokciem tenisisty.
links.belarusian: Адказвае са спагадай, нібыта выпаленыя рэшткі мінулага былі проста рабочым рызыкай. Такім міліцэйскім локцем тэнісіста.

links.title: You: ""I was dehydrated. It won't happen..."
links.english: "I was dehydrated. It won't happen again." (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Byłem odwodniony. To się nie powtórzy”. (Zakończ).
links.belarusian: «Я быў абязводнены. Гэта не паўторыцца». (Завяршэнне).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Right." he hands you the waterlogg..."
links.english: "Right." he hands you the waterlogged remains of your ledger.
links.polish: „Dobrze” – oddaje ci przemoczone resztki twojego notatnika.
links.belarusian: «Добра» — вяртае табе прамоклыя рэшткі твайго нататніка.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You dropped this -- are you okay t..."
links.english: "You dropped this -- are you okay to proceed?"
links.polish: „Upuściłeś to. Na pewno możesz pracować dalej?”
links.belarusian: «Ты гэта ўпаў. Напэўна, можаш працаваць далей?»

links.title: You: ""Let's solve this case." [Leave.]"
links.english: "Let's solve this case." [Leave.]
links.polish: „Rozwiążmy tę sprawę”. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: „Давайце вырашым гэтую справу”. [Адыдзі].

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good.""
links.english: "Good."
links.polish: „Świetnie”.
links.belarusian: "Выдатна".

links.title: Tutorial Agent: "The Ledger of Failure and Hatred is..."
links.english: The Ledger of Failure and Hatred is a special item that can be used both as an INTERACTABLE and a TOOL equipped in your HELD slot for skill bonuses. Find it under the TOOLS tab in your INVENTORY.
links.polish: Notatnik porażki i nienawiści to przedmiot specjalny, którego można używać zarówno jako przedmiot INTERAKTYWNY, jak i NARZĘDZIE, które możesz wziąć w DŁOŃ i otrzymać premię do umiejętności. Znajdziesz go w zakładce NARZĘDZI swojego EKWIPUNKU.
links.belarusian: Нататнік паражэння і нянавісці - гэта спецыяльны прадмет, які можна выкарыстоўваць як ІНТЭРАКТЫЎНЫ прадмет, а таксама як ІНСТРУМЕНТ, які можна ўзяць у РУКУ і атрымаць бонус да навыкаў. Яго можна знайсці ў ўкладцы ІНСТРУМЕНТЫ вашага ІНВЕНТАРА.

links.title: You: "Just nod. [Leave.]"
links.english: Just nod. [Leave.]
links.polish: Skiń tylko głową. [Odejdź].
links.belarusian: Толькі кіўні галавой. [Ідзі].

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I found this next to you." He paus..."
links.english: "I found this next to you." He pauses. "I'll tag along for the rest of the day if you don't mind. My business is concluded anyway. Are you okay to go?"
links.polish: „Znalazłem to przy tobie” – urywa. „Zostanę z tobą przez resztę dnia, jeśli nie masz nic przeciwko. I tak już załatwiłem swoje sprawy. Możemy ruszać?”
links.belarusian: «Знайшоў гэта побач з табой», — абрывае ён. «Застануся з табой на рэшту дня, калі ты нічога не маеш супраць. Усё адно я ўжо вырашыў свае справы. Можам рушыць?»

links.title: You: ""I... fuck it." Start climbing out..."
links.english: "I... fuck it." Start climbing out of the motor-car. (Conclude.)
links.polish: „Ja... Jebać to”. (Zacznij wychodzić z powozu motorowego – zakończ).
links.belarusian: «Я... Хай ідзе яно». (Пачніце выходзіць з маторнага вагону — скончыце).

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good." He hands you the waterlogge..."
links.english: "Good." He hands you the waterlogged remains of your ledger.
links.polish: „Świetnie” – oddaje ci przemoczone resztki twojego notatnika.
links.belarusian: «Выдатна» — вяртае табе прамоклыя рэшткі твайго нататніка.

links.title: You: ""No. I don't wanna.""
links.english: "No. I don't wanna."
links.polish: „Nie. Nie chcę”.
links.belarusian: «Не. Не хачу».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There is no use arguing with me. Y..."
links.english: "There is no use arguing with me. You will die if you don't." His voice is pressing: "DRINK."
links.polish: „Kłócenie się ze mną jest bezcelowe. Umrzesz, jeśli nie wypijesz” – jego głos jest pełen napięcia. „PIJ!”
links.belarusian: «Спрачацца са мной бессэнсоўна. Ты памрэш, калі не вып'еш», — ягоны голас паўнюткі напружання. «ПЕЙ!»

links.title: Volition: "There really *is* no use arguing wi..."
links.english: There really *is* no use arguing with him. This is him exerting the reserves of authority he usually withholds.
links.polish: Kłócenie się z nim naprawdę *jest* bezcelowe. Wykorzystuje rezerwy władczości, które zwykle przed tobą ukrywa.
links.belarusian: Скубацца з ім сапраўды *бескарысна*. Ён выкарыстоўвае рэзервы ўлады, якія звычайна ад цябе хавае.

links.title: You: ""No." Push it away."
links.english: "No." Push it away.
links.polish: „Nie” – odepchnij to.
links.belarusian: «Не» – адштурхні гэта.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Suit yourself." He caps the canist..."
links.english: "Suit yourself." He caps the canister, uninterested in your petulance. With his brow furrowed he asks:
links.polish: „Jak sobie chcesz” – zakręca pojemnik, nie zwracając uwagi na scenę, którą urządzasz. Marszcząc brwi, pyta:
links.belarusian: "Як сабе хочаш" — закручвае ёмістасць, не звяртаючы ўвагі на сцэну, якую ты ўладкоўваеш. Маршчыць бровы, пытаецца:

links.title: Volition: "There really *is* no use arguing wi..."
links.english: There really *is* no use arguing with him. This is him exerting the reserves of authority he usually withholds. You can't even try to resist. All you can do is...
links.polish: Kłócenie się z nim naprawdę *jest* bezcelowe. Wykorzystuje rezerwy władczości, które zwykle przed tobą ukrywa. Nie możesz nawet próbować stawiać oporu. Jesteś w stanie tylko...
links.belarusian: Спрачацца з ім сапраўды *бясцэльна*. Ён выкарыстоўвае запасы ўладнасці, якія звычайна ад цябе хавае. Ты нават не можаш спрабаваць аказаць супраціў. Ты толькі можаш...

links.title: Coupris Kineema: "Glowing lights on a dashboard emerg..."
links.english: Glowing lights on a dashboard emerge out of nothingness.
links.polish: Z nicości wyłaniają się światełka na desce rozdzielczej.
links.belarusian: З нішто з'яўляюцца агеньчыкі на прыборнай панэлі.

links.title: You: "What is that? It's cold..."
links.english: What is that? It's cold...
links.polish: A to co? Jest zimne...
links.belarusian: А гэта што? Халоднае...

links.title: Limbic System: "Yes, they're *pouring* something on..."
links.english: Yes, they're *pouring* something on you -- something *in* you. And it's...
links.polish: *Leją* coś na ciebie. Do twojego *wnętrza*. To...
links.belarusian: Нешта льюць на цябе. У тваё нутро. Гэта...

links.title: You: "No, I was *cool*. I'm cool."
links.english: No, I was *cool*. I'm cool.
links.polish: Nie, było *czadowo*. Czułem miły chłód.
links.belarusian: Не, было *класна*. Адчуваў прыемную прахалоду.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "The cool when you're dead, brother."
links.english: The cool when you're dead, brother.
links.polish: Chłód niczym śmierci, bracie.
links.belarusian: Холад, як смерць, брат.

links.title: You: "Nice and quiet."
links.english: Nice and quiet.
links.polish: Jest miło i cicho.
links.belarusian: Прыемна і ціха.

links.title: Ancient Reptilian Brain: "Is it? The world is gone, you're no..."
links.english: Is it? The world is gone, you're no longer reacting to outward stimuli. Yet still...
links.polish: Czyżby? Świat zniknął, nie reagujesz już na zewnętrzne bodźce. A mimo to...
links.belarusian: Ці ж сапраўды? Свет знік, ты больш не рэагуеш на знешнія раздражняльнікі. Але нягледзячы на гэта...

links.title: Limbic System: "...a bitter, caustic sense of loss..."
links.english: ...a bitter, caustic sense of loss remains. Even in the darkness, great sorrows slip in the water -- slimy.
links.polish: ...czujesz żrący, gorzki smak straty. Nawet w tym mroku pośród wód przemykają wielkie, oślizłe smutki.
links.belarusian: ...адчуваеш едкі, gorкі смак страты. Нават у гэтай цемры сярод вод праносцяцца вялікія, слізкія смуткі.
